candidates.title: Bump heim dependency version
candidates.body: Most important change is a fix for processes CPU usage calculation (see https://github.com/heim-rs/heim/issues/246)

candidates.title: Update Cargo.lock
candidates.body: Cargo.lock wasn't updated together with updates to Cargo.toml it seems which causes some issues for me since I always build with --frozen.

candidates.title: Implement login for the fetch command
candidates.body:
Closes #1734 

Implemented user/password login for the fetch command.

Tested with:
`fetch https://jigsaw.w3.org/HTTP/Basic/ -u guest -p guest`
- See [HTTP/1.1 demos](https://jigsaw.w3.org/HTTP/)

candidates.title: Move run to be async
candidates.body: This is (hopefully!) the first step in simplifying commands. In this step, we move to an async `.run()` on each command, which will allow us to more async processing before the `async_stream!` step.

candidates.title: ISSUE-1744-Glob support for start command
candidates.body:
https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/1744

Summary:
- Use the glob library to take an passed arguments and expand them into a list of filenames
- Supports passing multiple globs

TODO:
- [x] What types of shell errors should I be returning?
   - I don't know if the Shell Errors I returned are any good, but it's something 🤷 
- [ ] Figure out how to write tests... (Still not sure where to look for these)

Usage:
```bash
> start *.md
``` 
Results in opening up:
```
CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
CONTRIBUTING.md
README.md
TODO.md
```

candidates.title: Str plugin promoted to built-in Nu command.
candidates.body:
`str` is now built-in. Additionally, `str` now supports optionally multiple column paths. It can either operate on raw values or tables (given column's are supplied).

`open Cargo.toml | str upcase package.name package.version`

candidates.title: Add --to-float to str plugin
candidates.body:
Hello, 

I thought I will give a try and implement #1354 . At current stage it works but I do have small problem with float representation after conversion - final result has too many trailing zeros and [one my test](https://github.com/nushell/nushell/pull/1872/files#diff-f6135a125bc0a55b9b470fca0e4223e0) [tests/plugins/core_str.rs] fails because of it (Should be visible on CI). For example If I pass to CLI `echo "3.1415" | str --to-float` I do get `3.141500000000000`. 

Closes #1354

candidates.title: Tweak auto-rotate for single row output
candidates.body:
added helper to convert value data to strings
added ability to auto-rotate single row output
if row will be greater than terminal width

candidates.title: Move from language-reporting to codespan
candidates.body:
This moves us from `language-reporting` to `codespan-reporting`. While both are useful for reporting errors, codespan has a couple advantages:

* It's maintained and actively developed for new features and improvements
* It allows for better errors as we can do things like add notes to errors
* Has better utf-8 support, so underlines should be more correct

Fixes https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/1127

![Screenshot from 2020-05-18 20-04-47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/547158/82194801-7c95a400-994b-11ea-8dbf-16aeb00b2a46.png)

candidates.title: Evaluation of command arguments
candidates.body:
This PR adds the ability to evaluate an arbitrary block as part of argument evaluation.

Eg)

```
> echo $(= 1 + 4)
```
Or:

```
> echo $(sys).host.name
```

To do so, we needed to do a fairly extensive refactor of how arguments were processed.  The new system assumes that expression evaluation can be done async, in order to be able to process whole pipelines.

The amount of changes makes me suspect there will be breakages, but since we just put out a release, we should hopefully have time to calm any issues before the next release.

candidates.title: Use the directories crate instead of app_dirs
candidates.body:
The app_dirs crate is abandonned since quite a bit of time. Use the directories
crate instead, which is maintained and have more OS support.
